article.headline: Northeastern 56, Towson 49
article.story: TOWSON, Md. -- Jonathan Lee scored 13 points and Northeastern defeated Towson 57-48 Monday night for the Tigers' 33rd straight loss. Lee has scored in double figures in 21 of the past 24 games. Towson stayed close and trailed only 41-39 with 8:21 remaining in the second half before Northeastern went on an 11-2 run to lead 52-41 with 1:21 left. The Huskies (5-7, 1-1 Colonial Athletic Association) went the final 3 minutes without a field goal but iced the game by making 5 of 8 free-throw attempts in the final 1:21. Northeastern pulled away on the strength of 11-of-21 shooting in the second half. The Huskies scored 27 points off 18 Towson turnovers and outscored the Tigers 10-0 on fast break points. Towson's 49 points is the fewest allowed by Northeastern all season. Eric Gumbs and Marcus Damas each scored 14 points and Jervon Presley had 11 for Towson (0-13, 0-2)

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
